hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Positive Divergence & On-Chain Accumulation
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BEAR regime, if the 14-day RSI on BTC makes a higher low while price makes a lower low (bullish divergence), concurrently with the Net Unrealized Profit/Loss (NUPL) metric dipping into the 'Capituation' zone (<0) and the 30-day mean of Exchange Net Flow turning negative (sustained accumulation), a daily close above the 7-day high will signal a transition to a NEUTRAL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear regimes end with seller exhaustion. Bullish RSI divergence indicates weakening downward momentum. NUPL in capitulation suggests maximal pain/disbelief. Sustained negative exchange flow indicates strong hands are absorbing supply off-exchange. A break above a near-term high confirms a shift in short-term market structure, often the first step toward stabilization (NEUTRAL).
entry_conditions: Regime == BEAR for at least 15 days
BTC 14-day RSI shows a higher low vs. price's lower low over the past 10 days
30-day SMA of BTC Exchange Net Flow < -1,000 BTC (negative = accumulation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence > 65%) for 2 consecutive days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 10-day low, invalidating the divergence structure

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals fail to catalyze a regime shift, and price re-enters the bear trend to make a significant new low (>5%) within 15 days.
